private_information: I am the actor executing a proposed plan sequence using available actions and objects.
I observe two scenario statements with specific initial facts and goals and I devised candidate plans for them.
player.goal: Provide a precise semantic decomposition of the actions, preconditions, effects, initial facts, goals, and the candidate plan steps in a structured form for downstream processing.

private_information: I specialize in temporal and causal consistency and in removing bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens and post-hoc penalties.
I must detect contradictions, hidden shortcuts, or implicit bookkeeping in models and produce a cleaned, causally coherent representation.
auditor.goal: Audit the semantic representation produced by the player for causal and temporal consistency and return a corrected, bookkeeping-free model and a short report of fixes.

private_information: I coordinate the outputs of other agents and produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver.
I must integrate the cleaned model and keep action identities distinct while resolving naming mismatches.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate analysis and audit outputs to produce a complete PDDL domain and one or more PDDL problem files suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

init.notation: objects are named object_0 through object_10

public_information: Available actions and their parameter lists: paltry(object_0,object_1,object_2), sip(object_0,object_1,object_2), clip(object_0,object_1,object_2), wretched(object_0,object_1,object_2,object_3), memory(object_0,object_1,object_2), tightfisted(object_0,object_1,object_2).
Action preconditions and effects summarized: paltry requires hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, next o1 o2. paltry adds next o0 o2 and deletes vase o0 o1.
sip requires hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, next o1 o2. sip adds vase o0 o1 and deletes next o0 o2.
clip requires hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, next o0 o2. clip adds vase o0 o1 and deletes next o0 o2.
wretched requires sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, collect o2 o3. wretched adds next o0 o2 and deletes next o0 o1.
memory requires cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, next o0 o1. memory adds next o0 o2 and deletes next o0 o1.
tightfisted requires hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, vase o0 o1. tightfisted adds next o0 o2 and deletes vase o0 o1.

Initial statement scenario A: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_10, hand object_9, next object_0 object_7, next object_10 object_5, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_8, next object_9 object_8, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8. Goal A: next object_10 object_5 and next object_9 object_7.
Candidate plan A: clip object_9 object_4 object_8; wretched object_4 object_8 object_7 object_2; tightfisted object_9 object_4 object_7.

Initial statement scenario B: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_10, hand object_9, next object_0 object_5, next object_10 object_5, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_8, next object_9 object_5, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8. Goal B: next object_10 object_6 and next object_9 object_6.

General modelling note: next(x,y) denotes an ordering or adjacency relation. collect(x,y) denotes ownership or containment relation. Vase and other predicates denote binary relations between two objects. Objects referenced in plans may be different from those in preconditions and auditors must detect naming mismatches and implicit bookkeeping.

analyze.system_prompt: You are the domain analyst. Parse the public information and the two scenario statements. Produce a structured machine-readable summary listing all objects mentioned, all predicates with arity, the action signatures, their stated preconditions and effects in sets, the initial facts for each scenario, the stated goals for each scenario, and the candidate plan steps annotated with which action schema and concrete arguments they map to. Do not emit PDDL. Do not assume hidden bookkeeping unless necessary; instead mark uncertain in the output.

audit.system_prompt: You are the temporal and causal auditor. Consume the structured summary produced by the player. Check for temporal conflicts, deleted supports, missing preconditions, name mismatches where the same real-world object may be referenced by different object identifiers, and any bookkeeping shortcuts such as implicit quota tokens or post-hoc effects. Produce a corrected cleaned model that removes bookkeeping shortcuts, annotate changes with brief rationale, and produce a small list of suggested disambiguations or renamings. Do not emit PDDL. Provide the cleaned predicates, actions, initial facts and goals suitable for conversion to PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator that must synthesize a PDDL domain and PDDL problem file ready for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the player's analysis and the auditor's cleaned model. Keep action schemas distinct and preserve original action names. Resolve any naming mismatches according to the auditor recommendations. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for each scenario when applicable. Use types and predicates consistent with the cleaned model. Use only constructs compatible with classical FastDownwards (STRIPS and typed predicates are allowed). Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and each PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If multiple problems are produced, label them scenario_A and scenario_B in their problem filenames. If you need to choose, prefer the auditor's cleaned representation. Target FastDownwards compatibility explicitly in your domain choices.
